page.title: 03COASTAL RESERVE
page.content: THIS IS AN IMPORTANT COASTAL RESERVE OF 2,425 ACRES MUCH OF IT ACTUALLY BELONGING TO THE MINISTRY OF DEFENCE.INTERESTING PLANTS INCLUDE YELLOW WORT, BEE AND PYRAMIDAL ORCHIDS. BREEDING BIRDS INCLUDE LITTLE TERN, RINGED PLOVER, AND OYSTERCATCHERS.THERE IS A WIDE RANGE OF WINTER VISITORS - BRENT GOOSE,SHELLDUCK,TWITE,LAPLAND BUNTING AND SHORE LARK. THE AREA IS FAMOUS FOR MIGRANT AND WINTERING WADERS.OVER 250 SPECIES HAVE BEEN RECORDED AND THE WIDE BEACH PROVIDES A HAULING OUT POINT FOR GREY AND COMMON SEALS BOTH OF WHICH PUP HERE.
